titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: Supreme in Christ as we all confess,
Why need we prove would avail no jot
To make him God, if God he were not?

p.hi: What is the point where himself lays stress?
Does the precept run" Believe in good
"For the first time?" â€“ or "Believe in me.

div.p: "Am Lord of Life?" Whoever can take
The same to his heart and for more love's sake
Conceive of the love,– that man obtains
A new truth; no conviction gains
Of an old one only, made intense
By a fresh appeal to his faded sense.

body.p: I spent the morning in trying to prepare something for the afternoon, but, of all days in the world, Good Friday is most difficult for modern preachers. I motored o West Hartlepool, and led a procession through the streets. Freddie Macdonald carried the Cross: the Mayor walked beside me, behind us were our chaplains, the Presbyterian Minister & Knowlden respectively. I preached in the Town Hall, which was crowded: & afterwards spoke to a congregation in Christ Church.
